content: Do we already know where ACT 2023 will be?
Not officially, but I remember at the end of ACT2022 it seemed likely that it would be held in Florida.
Yes - @James Fairbanks and @Owen Lynch are already planning it out at the University of Florida.
So, if you have questions about it, they're the best ones to ask.
Owen is starting to plan some "tutorials" - a new feature, not in previous ACTs.
I think it's probably going to be held in Maryland!

Oh! But Fairbanks is running it, right?

Why will it be in Maryland? Will it be at NIST?

John Baez said:

Owen is starting to plan some "tutorials" - a new feature, not in previous ACTs.

Actually we had tutorials at ACT at MIT.
So I should have said "not in the last ACT".
Right, I’m local organizing chair. James is the big chair, chair chair, whatever it’s called. I thought I told you John.

Joe Moeller said:

Right, I’m local organizing chair. James is the big chair, chair chair, whatever it’s called. I thought I told you John.

In 2022 there was no hierarchy like this. Just the local organizers and the steering committee.
And even James was considered a local organizer

Joe Moeller said:

Right, I’m local organizing chair. James is the big chair, chair chair, whatever it’s called. I thought I told you John.

Maybe you did. When I recently (again?) heard James was organizing it I instantly assumed it would be at the University of Florida, since that's how things usually work. Who at the University of Maryland is going to be involved? Usually there's at least someone from the university involved, when a conference is at a university.

Anyway, it's great that you're the local organizing chair.
What are the estimated dates? :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
